events.text: While Wikipedia is a great place to look if you want a very general idea of something,
it is almost never considered an academically appropriate source to cite in your writing.
Its details are often not fact-checked extensively enough to be as reliable as other reputable sources like newspapers, journals, and texts from a library database.
You may, however, look at a Wikipedia articleâ€™s list of cited sources (at the end of each article) to search for more reliable information.
